lst.name: sentence
lst.str: S. intends to press its tough stance, and Japan, as expected rejects the demands, the issue may then be put to the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade for settlement, which would mean prolonging the friction beyond the April, 1988 deadline set by the U.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Agriculture Secretary Richard Lyng and Trade Representative Clayton Yeutter took a hardline stance on beef and citrus in talks here last week, insisting that the quotas be abandoned by April, 1988.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: A representative of Sunkist said the cooperative is concerned that in the absence of quotas, lower quality oranges from Israel and South Africa might be competitive in Japan.
